main_definition: Over is an adverb, preposition, or idiom that can have various meanings depending on the context. It generally implies a sense of excessiveness, superiority, completion, or supervision.

meanings_and_examples.example: The price was too high; it felt like paying over for such a product.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Above or higher in position, rank, importance, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: She held an executive position over her male colleagues.
We drove our car over the bridge to get to the other side of the river.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In excess, more than is necessary, required
meanings_and_examples.example: I spent an hour doing homework when I could have finished it in 30 minutes; I went over time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Under the control or supervision of someone else
meanings_and_examples.example: The project was completed under her guidance and expertise.
I've already done my work over; I can leave now.
